was an island province of Japan in the area of Nagasaki Prefecture near the island of Kyūshū. The province is also known as.
History.
In the Meiji period, the provinces of Japan were converted into prefectures. Maps of Japan and Iki Province were reformed in the 1870s.
Shrines and Temples.
"Amanotanagao jinja" was the chief Shinto shrine ("ichinomiya") of Iki.
